2151.subject: SPED
2151.descrlong: Based on current research which introduces important contemporary issues, such as the relationship between identification, assessment, and program planning for students with mild-severe disabilities. Covers formal and informal assessment, instructional strategies, curriculum design, and modifications which are relevant, age-appropriate and structured to ensure student success and independence in general education and other learner-centered environments. Course delivery options to include online, hybrid and face to face. (Offered fall and spring semesters.)
